Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Akgun Istanbul Hotel and booked it based upon Expedia profille.this is NOT a 5 star hotel, might be a 3.5 star hotel on a sunny day. The bathroom has a sign telling you that the water is not drinkable. To brush your teeth, you have to use bottled water which they charge you for. Half of the machines in the gymn are broken. The rooms facing the street are so loud from street traffic that it's hard to go to sleep. Very few of the staff speak English and those that do provide little help.I travel worldwide and stay in 5 star hotels. This place is a joke!

Reviews.Title: “How is this a five star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: alex S
Reviews.Content: I do not understand how this is a five star hotel. I have stayed here with my family and thought this was going to be a nice place to stay. They say they have a gym, the treadmill - elliptical and bike machine do not work. They have a bench without weights? The rooms are far from what you expect, hard and small. They have three English channels to watch, not great ones at that. Service has not been great, had to call three times to get them to fix something for us. All around it's not a hotel thats worth it's money. Location is not great either. Best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “My experience on Akgun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinodyn
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Istanbul and Radisson (where I generally stay) happened to be full and so was hotels like WOW and Renaissance Polat! This hotel was recommened and I went along as I could not miss the dates (Business visit). The hotel is in Topkapi and that was a plus point (Boy what a disappointment). The room rates are extravagant, to put it mildly. Internet is a disappointment and the service is abysmal! There checking time is 12:00 and they made me wait till 2:00 for a room. The rooms are large enough but poorly lighted. Except for 1 or 2 places which is accessible by rail metro going anywhere you need to hire a cab! Breakfast if you are cereals person then it is good for you or you are in for a disappointment! They have lot of variety of Cheese and butter but not much other choices. I survived on bread and butter or cheese!!!!! The hotel staff in general are not very helpful and hardly anyone speaks English!!! The only passable view is from the room that is facing the road! Rest all rooms have either buildings covering! In there website they talk about gym but when you go and enquire you'll be surprised. Firslty the person managing will try to sell you the message packages. When you stress that you are looking for the gym you'll find out that the gym is converted into a massage room and the masseur is a woman (I later learn this is the highlight of the hotel)! In totality this hotel should be your last choice and that to if you are staying not more than 2 -3 nights and not planning to be in the hotel for not more than sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Better if its a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mytours24
Reviews.Content: Akgun is a five star hotel with 3 star or below facilities. Very small and slow lifts, break fast selections were very less, staff can improve too much, room heaters with too much noice, slow internet etc...

Reviews.Title: “After reading reviews, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Ercelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights. November 4 when we arrived from the US and November 13 & 14, 2011 before our return to the US. The hotel is near a section of the city walls,but there is not a lot to do or to see in the area. A Burger King is about 6 blocks away. I found the room to be spacious, modern and clean. The furniture and decor in the halls is dark, but that maybe a Middle Eastern style of decoration. The WiFi in the room worked easily. The sheets and the towels were very soft. The food was very good with several options on the buffet. The only complaint was that the bottled water was always warm. Since we could not drink the water or use ice, it was not very refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “5 star, I think not.”
Reviews.Author: mik4647
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a 5 star "front of house", but 3 star rooms and food. I travelled on business to this hotel, and I am sure that I have stayed they previously. However, it has not changed much, and the first time I stayed must have been 10 years ago! The rooms are "dingey" the barthrooms in particular are in dire need of restoration. The food was poor at best, "buffet style, and if you arrive towards the closing time, you will find that what food there may have been initially, has not been replenished. Most items were European 5 star prices, how do they get away with it? In fact the only positive comment that I would make is that the doormen were attentative and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kamsutra
Reviews.Content: The rooms are smelly and the furniture is poor. Not sure how this hotel ever got a 5 start rating. What a rip-off. The staff barely speaks english and they have no clue about customer service. The airconditioning was weak and we ended up opening the windows and it was too noisy as the hotel fronts a busy street. The breakfast buffet was decent but no omelet and the coffee is pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Bob V
Reviews.Content: Very old hotel but pretty nice rooms. It is not near anything forcing you to eat there. Small buffet supper would be about $20 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel should pay guests to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: me1000uk
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of being put in this hotel as a result of an overbooked Turkish Air flight. They told me it is central and 5 star!!! Yea Right!!! This hotel is anything but a 5 star. The toilet/shower was tiny; the bed had the worst quality mattress I've ever seen and the a/c did not regulate any kind of temperature. Not only that, but they don't even provide you with an Iron, or a travel adaptor (according to the helpful chap at the desk, 5 star hotels don't do this). The only consolation is I didn't pay for this bout of suffering, and I strongly advise people to stay there only if they get an offer they cannot refuse. The breakfast is adequate, and the location is pretty bad, although there is a metro station 1 minute away which the receptionist was unaware of!, which stops at a tramway interchange (the interchange is a 5 minute walk from the stop). I guess in conclusion, one must manage their expectations. It is literally the standard of a Travelodge hotel in the UK and don't expect any more. At least travelodge gives you an iron if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MaxCircus
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here while on a tour of Turkey. While not a five-star hotel as it is listed, we found it was a good hotel for our stay in Istanbul. We got a room that had a comfortable bed and updated bathroom. The bathroom had a window in the shower that looked out into the room. Had never seen that before and it was an interesting design feature. The room also had a free bottle of water and a tea kettle which we used for our morning coffee. The dinner buffet was more memorable than breakfast. We stayed here for the first two nights of our trip and again for the last night before flying home. The last night we got a room that had a major mold problem in the shower which gave a very noticeable smell to the room. We didnâ€™t want the hassle of trying to change rooms so we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “THY chooses good hotels!”
Reviews.Author: comnen
Reviews.Content: Turkish Airlines provides passengers with overnight connection with the hotel. Akgun was very good choice. Good location, good rooms, a number of facilities available. We were arranged very easily, the staff in the morning called several times to remind of the flight, worrying if to order a taxi. In a room there is tea and coffee, wifi. I checked the prices on hotel website, they are worth it

Reviews.Title: “short overnight stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Goscha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the historic part of Istanbul near the wall of the city Constantinople and the Metro Topkapi Ulubatli. This is large hotel with the concept of high service. We got a spacious room with good furnishings. In addition to the basic necessities we had tea, coffee, minibar, satellite TV and Wi-Fi in the room. Neat and clean. Also in price included a sauna, hammam and gym. Unfortunately we did not have time to take advantage as they were at the hotel only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever experienced in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DeeHoughDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not 5 stars, I don't know why it has this rating. It is outdated, the rooms are basic and the food is terrible. The service is absolutely appalling. We were charged room service rates for our dinner (which was awful) which we had to point out to the waitor who reluctantly changed the bill. I then had the worst night's sleep as the room was way too hot. When I went down to reception to complain they told me they only have heat as it is winter (actually autumn). I wasn't even offered a fan and another member of staff actually laughed at me. The noise level was a disgrace, our room was on a busy main road. When we complained the manager wouldn't listen. We left and got charged for the 2nd night due to their 24 hr cancellation policy. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “5 star- No Way”
Reviews.Author: siobhanNewry
Reviews.Content: This is a so called 5 star hotel. The rooms were very dirty, the food was horrible, there was nothing nice about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “It is NOT the 5 stars hotel. Most of stuff in the hotel are in the awful condition”
Reviews.Author: apetrenko
Reviews.Content: the condition of the room was terrible. we've stayed the hotel one night and it was enough for saying a lot of not polite words for condition of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel- nothing more, nothing less.”
Reviews.Author: StudioChinn
Reviews.Content: It seems this hotel caters to the traveling-through crowd. It is not located near any tourist sites or the airport but it is a reliable place.The staff is attentive and quick. The lobby is large enough to hold a tour coach worth of people with room to spare. The bar is adjacent with even more seats. Nice gift shop near the elevators. All the rooms are different in terms of what state of remodeling 0r renovation you will find it. I had several rooms here and all are quirkily a little different. You might ask to look at it if you are staying more than one night. Morning breakfast on the mezzanine above the lobby is bountiful and fresh with certain Turkish specialties. You can peek over the railing to keep an eye on your tour group while munching .

Reviews.Title: “It's really good!”
Reviews.Author: Lilia_Ablyazova
Reviews.Content: Our guests liked this hotel as there was provided for everything what we needed: perfect service, delicious breakfast, commodious and light rooms. We had some problems with money transfer and there was a dely with 3 or 5 days but there was not problem with that for Hotel manager. He undersood the situation and gave us time so that we could solve our problem with transfer without panic and press. so we had just the best experience with this hotel and once again I would like to express my respect to administration.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: brainus
Reviews.Content: Got to Akgun in the middle of the night after a delayed flight from Bangkok, just for a few hours of sleep before continuing to Stockholm. Reception awful, rudest we have ever encountered, plus the slowest. Dirty sheets with holes in them. Could feel every spring in the bed. Walls and carpets dirty. Hinges loose. Lock not working in door. Shower basically useless. Breakfast really poor, except for the boiled eggs, which actually were edible. I was expecting the elevators to be out of order, but they worked fine. Of course they were dirty too. NOT a five-star hotel, not even close. Would never stay anywhere near the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Big NO NO”
Reviews.Author: elads
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel in the afternoon wasnâ€™t a pleasant welcome with grumpy front desk staff. We got a room with two twin beds and not a double bed as ordered. Going back to the front desk, no one wanted to deal with us. Only after I raised my voice did the reception manager come forward to assist. So for the first night we stayed at the twin bed room. I thought of connecting the beds, but the filth under the bed made me think again. The next morning we went to have breakfast, which was more of a 3 star hotel one. We came back to a double bed room that was smelly and the shower was old and really not fun. All in all, the hotel is very dimly lit and the staff hardly speaks English. With that, they are too unpleasant (to the complete contrary of the kindness and helpfulness of the local people in Istanbul). To conclude, the Akgun hotel can be considered a 3 star one, to the best. It is ages away from being a 5 star hotel. We strongly recommend avoiding this hotel when traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “For God sake stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brigh2n
Reviews.Content: Staff are rude Accommodation is terrible Terrible food (my soon ate their French fries and end up in Alman Hospital for a day for food poisoning) Location is terrible Access to other amenities is terrible I will give is at best one star max. If I have to give rating Please donâ€™t go there, if you are planning to enjoy your holiday

Reviews.Title: “Defintely not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: OranitGeranium
Reviews.Content: We were there for four nights. staff not as professional and/or polite as expected. Rooms average, bathroom very small and disapointing (far from being rated as 5 stars - we would say more like 2 stars). We had to repeat each evening the same requests. They were saving on toilet paper, soap etc. ....Breakfast not reach enough and last but not least - bad location (far from all interesting sites). We are not coming back to this one, ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star....HAAAA!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PacificParadise001
Reviews.Content: You have got to be joking giving this hotel a 5 Star Rating. A Blind man would be lucky to give it even 3 stars. It doesnt even deserve that! I travel on average once a month and to 4 and 5 star hotels, the morning staff are so impolite and rude, I am surprised they are employed there. In Australia, they would be fired within 2 weeks of being employed at any half descent hotel. Upon check in I was asked for my passport. I gave it. Then when he finally saw I was with a person next to me (took him like 3 minutes to figure that), he than asked how many guests. I said my wife and I. He than said, "two guests, two passports" And rudely! He saw I was with my partner, he could have asked for two passports nicely the first time. The Photos you see are no where like the hotel itself. They only turn on 30% of the lights. Its dark, smelly and so gloomy. And we havent gotten to the room yet! I will never ever go back to this hotel and I suggest no one in their right mind do so too. They will be in for a shock. Breakfast 2 out of 10. I gave it 2 because the male staff were rather attentitive to my wife. She asked for tea, they promptly served her. I asked, well thats another story..........

Reviews.Title: “Akgun - worst hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyCanberra
Reviews.Content: My advice - if you get the choice between Akgun Hotel and a tent, choose the tent! Rooms were very bad: elecrtical wiring hanging out of the wall - serious safety/fire hazard, the lifts continually broke down (while you were in them!), overcharged us on our laundry by telling us AFTER we had it done that it was charged in $US. The increased the price on beers from the bar when our tour buses arrived back from Gallipoli, staff were very rude and unprofessional, money exchange was the highest I saw it in Turkey, airconditioning did not work in any rooms, beds and rooms themselves were very uncomfortable and dirty... and that was only after 4 nigths stay! If you book a tour through Albatross tours it is one of their preferred hotels so beware!

Reviews.Title: “terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: sharmaOslo
Reviews.Content: Giving this hotel 5 stars is a joke I have seen 3 star properties better than this. We checked in as we had an overnight stay in istanbul. The rooms are very small, smaller than what you imagine. the bathroom was old and had a moist smell. The staff was grumpy and most unpolite. They behaved nothing like proffessionals. When I ordered food from room service they refused to add the billing to my creditcard and wanted only cash payment and the waiter stood outside my room and held back the food until I came back after being forced to change money. I will definetly not recomend this hotel. In Istanbul one should stick to the international branded hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: WeWillTravelMore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a group of 150 others. They could not cope with the check-in and the lift struggled with baggage and people. The rooms were well sized and clean and neat, but nothing special. The breakfast was enough to get you started, although they had some strange items in the buffet! I found the staff to be quite helpful, but could be abrupt when busy. The lobby area has a lounge, bar, and mezzanine restaurant area. Overall I found this hotel to be quite comfortable and in a good area central to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby...”
Reviews.Author: RamblinHeart
Reviews.Content: We were housed at the Akgun for a three night Gallipoli tour and would highly recommend it. The free breakfast was iffy, but the rooms and staff were top notch. The front door staff negotiated with Taxi drivers on our behalf, so we had the confidence to negotiate rates on return and reception was more than helpful with any questions we had. As long as you remember that five star in Turkey does not mean the same as five star London or New York, the Akgun shouldnt disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars...?”
Reviews.Author: DannyRy
Reviews.Content: We were three in a room. The third bed was impossible to sleep on it. The other two were not much better, but the third one was unbelievable and not human. Nobody cared about our complains. We stayed there four nights. Twice the room was not ready at 15:30. The breakfast was awful, the gym and the sauna were never opened in time, and the people at the reception were clumsy, unhelpful and not friendly at all. It is qualified as a five stars hotel. It was a horrible experience. Never again.
